results.title: As is
results.creator_credit: Michael Lindsay-Hogg, Iris Merlis, Brandman Productions and Interchange Television Group
results.brief_description: Based on a play by William M. Hoffman, this made for television feature length film was originally produced for Broadway by The Circle Repertory Company and The Glines. Reflective, confronting, compassionate, and experimental in treatment and language “As is” deals up-front with the issue of AIDS in its early days, documenting the different phases from all angles, from the victim through to the lover, the friends, the family and the health carers. Through a montage of scenes, multi-layered, past and present, we witness the story of Rich (Robert Carradine), a Manhattan-based writer who discovers he has a pre-AIDS condition, subsequently finding himself being ostracised by one and all. Alienated and surrounded by fear and paranoia Rich has to mentally come to terms with AIDS and the ignorance which exists amongst the general population, including the medical fraternity, about this new disease. His friend and ex-lover Saul (Jonathan Hadary) is there to support Rich through the emotional stages of fear, anger, denial, cynicism, death vs the will to live, and finally, acceptance. Colleen Dewhurst is outstanding as the hospice worker who through her monologues to the camera tells us what it’s like caring for AIDS patients, her emotional attachments and her anger and frustration with this disease called AIDS. Although acted and directed in a theatrical style, “As is” still is an exceptional film, informative and compassionate, and particularly interesting from an historical viewpoint. Cast also includes Joanna Miles, Allan Scarfe.

results.title: Arturo Toscanini
results.creator_credit: United Films and United States. Office of War Information
results.brief_description: Toscannini conducts the NBC Symphony Orchestra in a spirited rendition of Giuseppe Verdi’s “Hymn of the Nations”. With the Westminster Choir, featuring Jan Peerce as soloist, this performance was part of a celebration to mark the liberation of Italy during World War II. The film also sketches the life of Toscannini, showing the way in which he lived up to his convictions. No other credits available.

results.title: Artists must live
results.creator_credit: John Read, John Elliot, BBC-TV and Great Britain Arts Council
results.brief_description: Explores the relationship between the artist and his patron. Shows the problems facing contemporary artists and the opportunities offered by institutional and industrial sponsors, the modern successors to wealthy private patrons. Painters and sculptors featured in this film include John Piper, Keith Vaughan, Patrick Heron, Ridrigo Moynihan, Evor Hitchens, Reg Butler, Clifford Ellis, J.M.W. Turner, Jacob Epstein and Henry Moore. The narrator is the well-known art critic Basil Taylor; the film includes scenes at the Slade School, the Bath Academy, the Tate Gallery, and other centres of art in Britain.

results.title: Artists and artisans at Orrefors
results.brief_description: Artists and artisans at work in the Orrefors glass-works in Sweden. We see how they design their work, how they find aesthetic and practical solutions to functional problems, and all stages of the blowing of glass. Artists hand-paint designs onto glass, then they hand-engrave the design to complete the article. Many fine examples of Orrefors glassware are included. No credits available.

results.title: Artistic expression
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Overviews the artisitic expression of two innovative photographers, Nathan Lyons and Susan Rankaitis. The curator of the George Eastman House discusses the highly individualistic images produced by these photographers.

results.title: Artisans of Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This video is an intimate view of traditional building and restoration techniques through the eyes of master craftsmen and women. It reveals rare skills which are fast disappearing in this rapidly changing world. The film has six sections each examining an individual craft: timbercraft, stonecraft, glasscraft, ironcraft, solid plastering and decorative paint work.
results.description: This video is an intimate view of traditional building and restoration techniques through the eyes of master craftsmen and women.
